# Data

The dataset comes from the [City of Long Beach Animal Care Services](https://www.longbeach.gov/acs/) via the {animalshelter} R package. This dataset comprises of the intake and outcome record from Long Beach Animal Shelter.

Thank you to Lydia Gibson for curating this week's dataset.

```{r}

# Clean data provided by {animalshelter} R package (https://emilhvitfeldt.github.io/animalshelter/). No cleaning was necessary.
# install.packages("devtools")
# devtools::install_github("EmilHvitfeldt/animalshelter")
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)

longbeach <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-03-04/longbeach.csv')

longbeach <- longbeach %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    was_outcome_alive = as.logical(was_outcome_alive),
    dplyr::across(
      c(
        "animal_type",
        "primary_color",
        "secondary_color",
        "sex",
        "intake_condition",
        "intake_type",
        "intake_subtype",
        "reason_for_intake",
        "jurisdiction",
        "outcome_type",
        "outcome_subtype"
      ),
      as.factor
    )
  ) %>%
    dplyr::select(-dplyr::any_of("intake_is_dead"))

ggplot(
  longbeach, aes(x = animal_type, fill = animal_type)
) +
  geom_bar(position = "stack") +
  labs(
    x = "Animal Type",
    y = "Count",
    title = "Types of Animals at Long Beach Animal Shelter", 
    fill = "Animal Type"
  )

```
